Description: Painted limestone shabti of Djymry with a striated black lappet-wig with braids, a brown carved face with black eyebrows and white eyes outlined with black, a red, yellow and green collar, crossed hands in high relief holding incised red and yellow hoes(one with a broad blade), the body is painted white, the legs are inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in six rows of incised black hieroglyphs separated by incised red lines extending around the sides, the back of one arm is decorated with an incised representation of a red and yellow seed-basket.
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 52 [19].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
